sense.name: a person under the guardianship or custody of another
sense.examples: These orphans are wards of the state. The court declared that the child is now a ward of his wealthy uncle.

sense.name: administrative district of a city
sense.examples: Volunteers were out canvassing these wards before the last election. John used to be a councilor in one of the bigger wards of the city.

sense.name: functional unit of a hospital
sense.examples: The nurse's new rotation is in the oncology ward. They are allowed to bring comfort pets into the children's ward at the local hospital. We heard Tom was in the emergency ward last night.

sense.name: cell block in a prison
sense.examples: There has been a hunger strike in one of the prison wards. Each ward contains 54 cells which each hold two prisoners.

sense.name: notched metal ridge in a keyhole that a key fits into
sense.examples: This old key does not fit the ward of that door's keyhole. The locksmith said the ward of the door lock had somehow become damaged.

sense.name: the grounds inside the encircling wall of a fortress
sense.examples: The guide showed us around the ward of the 13th-century castle. The livestock stayed inside the walls on the ward during the siege of the fortress.

sense.name: the state of being in official custody
sense.examples: These peasants are in the ward and care of the Crown.

sense.name: anything which serves a protective role
sense.commentary: WARD[+relation][+role][+protective] Note: can refer to objects or actions, the central meaning is that it serve a protective role
sense.examples: These pendants are used as wards against the evil eye. Garlic is said to be an effective ward against vampires. They bowed to the idol every morning as a ward against bad luck.

sense.name: the act of guarding something
sense.examples: The king has ordered his guards to keep ward at the four gates.

sense.name: a defensive posture or motion in fencing
sense.examples: Bob's skillful ward of Mary's thrust of her epee surprised her. Our fencing instructor taught us two new wards today.
